hadiths.english_translation: Biographical entry: He heard from al-Sa'ib ibn Yazid and Yazid ibn Khasifah. Yahya al-Qattan heard from him. Ibn Abi Uways said: He is al-Kindi. Al-Makkiy said: I heard from al-Ju'aid, Abdullah ibn Sa'id ibn Abi Hind, and Hashim ibn Hashim in the year forty-four. Mansur ibn Salamah said: From Sulayman ibn Bilal, from Ju'aid al-Tamimi, from al-Sa'ib ibn Yazid.

narrators.name: Al-Ju'aid
reliabilityIssues: identity uncertain due to multiple attributions

chainIssues: This is biographical information with multiple variant attributions and identity confusions
This is biographical information with variant transmission forms

potential_issues.issue: Different transmission paths with varying narrators mentioned (Ibn Abi Uways, al-Makkiy, Mansur ibn Salamah)
potential_issues.impact: Textual variants and transmission inconsistencies

potential_issues.issue: Specific date given: 'year forty-four' (44 AH) for one transmission
potential_issues.impact: Chronological markers help establish timeline but also show multiple transmission periods

potential_issues.issue: This is biographical information describing multiple transmission paths rather than a single complete hadith
potential_issues.impact: Cannot assess full hadith reliability without knowing the actual transmitted text

hadiths.english_translation: Biographical entry: From Ikrimah and al-A'idh al-Ju'fi. Some say Mahallim ibn Tamim. Muhammad ibn Rabi'ah narrates from him. Disconnected chain.

chainIssues: Explicitly marked as munqat' (disconnected chain)
Central narrator is Majhul (unknown)
Multiple Majhul narrators in chain: al-A'idh al-Ju'fi and Muhammad ibn Rabi'ah
